title: I live in an old school
body:
My dear readers,

What i am about to tell you is 100% true.

I am a young recent graduated artist, boy oh boy is the starving artist an accurate stereotype. Because of my low income i had to find an affordable place. I decided that living “anti-squatting” was the best option. This is how i ended up moving into a classroom. The school i live in was build in 1920 and is a monument, so to say that it has a history would be accurate.

Right above my room is the attic, its in its old original state and you can see the structured woodwork. The ceiling/roof is incredible high and the lights don’t work so I’ve never seen it. My room alone has 4 meter (13.1 feet) high just to give an idea how high the roof is. One of my neighbors hung a boxing bag there, so id regularly heard him practice.

The first few months i lived there there was hardly anything worthy of mentioning. But after about a year or so i started hearing sounds above my head. It sounds like footsteps of a rather sizable human. The sounds usually wouldn’t last long and only appeared late at night. It wasn’t pacing around it only took a few steps when the sound stopped.

This kept happening on and off, after ignoring it for a while i figured it could’ve been rodents. Its big building after all and i do live in an urban area. I lifted my ceiling panels to have a peek up there, perhaps i could find some mouse droppings. But unfortunately there was nothing more than dust, cobwebs and dead insects.

I decided to ask my neighbors if they went up at night and if so if they would try to avoid it as much as possible. Since i could clearly hear them walk. But they told me they didn’t go there that often (only the one that hung the bag), but he didn’t practice at night.

I kept ignoring it, mostly because I’ve seen enough horror stories to know that investigating at night by yourself is a terrible idea. After about 1,5 years the sound started to become a bit more frequent at night and it seemed like there were more steps now than before.

One night the steps woke me up again, and i laid there listening where they went. Curiosity got the better of me i wanted to know (and still do) what was walking in the attic at night without really going anywhere. I grabbed my phone to use as flashlight and just incase i brought my biggest knife with me. I left my room as quietly as i possibly could, but as soon as i stepped into the hallway the sound was gone. I pressed onward and went upstairs. Of course there was nothing to see. The sound had disappeared and whoever was there was gone before i arrived.

I kept doing this every time i heard the footsteps, but every time i found the same empty looking attic.

Ive been living there for 2 years now, i still hear the steps and i still haven’t found out the source.
author: Lady-Lilithh
